 001: '''
 002: Created on 26/04/21
 003: 
 004:     This is my refined Cython code, currently in development. The idea this 
 005:     will be more general, i.e. can take any slow roll potential and compute
 006:     the importance sampling case. This requires both a relfective and absorbing
 007:     surface.
 008:     
 009:     This assumes the evolution of the potential is right ot left in phi.
 010:     
 011:     I've added code which allows the bias to be passed as a function, such that
 012:     it can take any form.
 013:     
 014: @author: Joe Jackson
 015: '''
